channel.title: Inigo Val Slijepcevic
channel.description: Recent content on Inigo Val Slijepcevic

item.title: Resume
item.description: Education MPhys - Oxford University (Jesus College) - Scholar 4 year integrated masters degree, with focus on Theoretical Physics and Astrophysics. Awarded a scholarship by Jesus College for high academic achievement. Research & Professional Experience PhD Student | 09.20 - Present | Manchester, UK Applying & developing cutting edge machine learning techniques to improve radio galaxy classification. Currently developing bespoke contrastive learning techniques for astronomical data. Used semi-supervised learning to leverage unlabelled data for classification.

item.title: Publications
item.description: NeurIPS 2021 | Machine Learning and the Physical Sciences Workshop | Can semi-supervised learning reduce the amount of manual labelling required for effective radio galaxy morphology classification? | https://github.com/inigoval/fixmatch

item.title: About
item.description: Machine learning/Astronomy PhD student with Dr Anna Scaife @ University of Manchester. University of Oxford MPhys graduate. My PhD work involves building robust machine learning systems process the vast deluge of data (exabyte scale) we are about to receive from next-generation telescopes. Since this much data cannot be curated by humans, we need AI that can deal with messy, real-world data with few labels and many possible anomalies. My research has included semi-supervised learning and use of unlabelled data for improved classification in the astronomy domain, bespoke contrastive learning applied to astronomical data-sets and use of generative algorithms to simulate astronomical objects.
